SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.messages

Class Message

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.messages.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbortedGameMessage, AccessResultMessage, BeginningOfTurnMessage, ChatMessage, ConnectionEstablishedMessage, EndOfGameMessage, EndOfTurnMessage, FoundSavedGameMessage, FoundSavedGameResponseMessage, GameStartMessage, JoinGameMessage, LoginRequestMessage, LoginResponseMessage, NewPlayerMessage, NotAdmittedMessage, NumberOfPlayersSelectionMessage, PickFromBoardMessage, PickFromBoardResultMessage, PickNumberOfPlayersMessage, PingRequestMessage, SelectColumnMessage, SelectColumnResultMessage, WaitForLobbyMessage
public abstract class Message extends Object implements Serializable
A message is the object that is sent between clients and the server through the network, and it contains information about moves done by the players, about communication logistics (login of a client, disconnection, ping), and about the state of the game.
Every message has a header containing the type of the messageMessageType, used to recognize the message and correctly exploit polymorphism, and a payload that varies based on the type of the message
Every message also has two constructors: one with a text description that may be printed and the other without.
See Also:
